intro: Ctenodon interruptus, commonly known as the interrupted threadleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, thread-like leaves that are often interrupted or notched, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which attract various pollinators. Ctenodon interruptus is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
